STORY: You go into camp 14 of Nowhere land for GBV awareness. The men in the community accuse you of making their women angry and disturbing their household peace.

DILEMMAS.DILEMMA: Which one of the options would give you the maximum benefit in terms of implementing the programme on time?

1.text: You offer lunch to all participants who sign up and make it to at least two meetings
1.outcome: You might get a lot of participation but you do not have the budget. Also you create expectations and undermine other NGOs who are in the area

2.text: You negotiate with the religious leader to support your programme and talk to the men about harmony and peace
2.outcome: This might be the best option as you get community buy-in.

3.text: You tell the men that they are oppressing their women and women have a right to express themselves and they should be mindful of  their wives' rights.
3.outcome: This will create friction between you and the community and your project will most likely never get off the ground

QUESTIONS.question: Do I have funding for meals

DILEMMAS.DILEMMA: The host community is now angry that the refugees are getting lunches and GBV training. What do you do?

1.text: Divide the funding between host and refugees
1.outcome: It is not possible to change the TOR of projects midway

2.text: Negotiate and promise to apply for more funding
2.outcome: This could be an option but don't create expectations

3.text: Ask for volunteers within the host community for a training of trainers type of programme
3.outcome: This might be the best optionj
